intro: Sampaiella, commonly known as the coastal daisy, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow flowers with a distinctive white center, which bloom in spring and summer. Sampaiella thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found along the edges of coastal dunes. It is well adapted to salt spray and can tolerate periods of drought.
